column4: basically device manager doesn't see my sound card at all, and i want to find out which driver to install. i don't know the exact model number but it's an older creative card.
pastebin details from http://wiki.ubuntu.com/DebuggingSoundProblems
I'm waiting for your pastebin entry.
you want the pastebin from lspci -nv?
that's just one of the things requested.
it _is_ using alsa.
yes, yes. Where's the pastebin?
use http://paste.ubuntu-nl.org
that paste is incomplete
what do you mean it's incomplete
it's missing output from the additional steps
all save the last two steps
that still only lists some output from dmesg (not complete) and /proc/interrupts
thats not my fault
then output it to a file, and post it on a public web site
not everything is running because the sound card isnt installed
err, it's _not installed_?
meaning your pci peripheral isn't installed?
I'm concerned about the _hardware_ being installed. Your computer does not recognize _any_ pci audio devices.
Windows does, Ubuntu doesn't you mean
so, reenable all sound devices in bios when you reboot. Then we'll resume debugging.
i disabled *just* the onboard in bios as that was the only selection
then power down the machine and physically read me the information from the peripheral.
